page.title: 10Delph 1
page.content: The picturesque{Pennine village of {Delph}is situated in the valley of the River Tame surrounded by well kept moorland fields enclosed by dry stone walls. It is a{small, quiet village with one main street (A6052) and several side streets. The main A62 Oldham to Huddersfield road passes through the southern end of the village. Most of the{buildings}are constructed from local Millstone Grit and most date from{Victorian times and {earlier.}There are many old{handloom {weavers' cottages}with their distinctive mullioned windows. Some are black from the atmospheric pollution but many have been {sandblasted}clean recently. There are modern houses too; large, detached and expensive and often built in the local stone to blend in with older property.
